channel.title: Health
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Health, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'People want to look good': Researcher hopes redesigned walker will remove stigma
item.description: People who need walkers are often reluctant to start using them because of stigma. A Colorado researcher has designed a walker she says has more appea...

item.title: Wegovy pill now available at pharmacies
item.description: The Wegovy pill approved in December arrived at pharmacies nationwide on Monday. Patients now have a new way to take the weight loss medication.

item.title: How to Support Your Brain Health as You Age
Tips to Ease Joint Ache When the Weather Changes
11 Daily Habits That Support Weight Loss and a Healthier Liver
item.description: Small daily changes can add up to real weight loss and a healthier liver. Try these habits that support fat loss and reduce liver inflammation.

item.title: More seniors are becoming homeless. Shelters are trying to adapt
item.description: Older adults are the fastest-growing homeless population across the U.S. Now some shelters are trying to make it easier to accommodate older people.

item.title: What’s Better: Short Walks Vs. One Long Walk? New Research Has The Answer
item.description: A new study suggests that longer walks may offer more health perks than short bursts of micro movements.

item.title: This Daily Drink Helps Calm My Bloating & Constant Hunger (Plus, It’s MD-Approved)
item.description: And I genuinely love the flavor.

item.title: This Mimics The Longevity Benefits Of Exercise — Here’s Where To Get It
item.description: New research suggests that one naturally occurring compound may mimic the longevity benefits of working out. Here's how to get it.

item.title: Wegovy obesity pill now available at pharmacies
item.description: Drugmaker Novo Nordisk said the prescription medicine can be found at a range of pharmacies, including CVS and Costco, as well as some telehealth prov...

item.title: Health officials slash the number of vaccines recommended for all kids
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is reducing the number of vaccines recommended for all children. The action follows a presidential memo...

item.title: Why More Workouts Aren’t Better — And What To Do Instead
item.description: How to structure your weekly workouts for real results (without overtraining)

item.title: Does Your Body Have An "Energy Budget?" New Study Shows A Surprising Answer
